newsitem.title: USA: USDA extends meat hearing due to wide interest.
newsitem.headline: USDA extends meat hearing due to wide interest.

text.p: U.S. Agriculture Department said Friday it would add a half-day to a planned public hearing Tuesday on its proposed new inspection models for meat and poultry, known as Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP).

The agency's Food Safety and Inspection Service said in a notice published in the Federal Register that it would extend the meeting by an additional half-day because of the large number of industry groups that wanted to appear at the hearing.
The meeting will be held all day Tuesday at the Arlington Hilton Hotel, and will now end at noon at Wednesday.

"Even though the time for the meeting is being extended, FSIS is aware of concerns among those planning to attend that there still may not be enough time for presentations on inspection-related topics," the agency said. Meeting participants were requested to limit oral remarks to five minutes, and an official transcript of the meeting will be held open for any last-minute written comments, the agency said.
FSIS will have at the meeting copies of short papers representing the agency's current thinking on HACCP-based meat and poultry inspection.
